level.heading: Preferences in appointment of guardian of estate.
level.text: In appointing a guardian of the estate of an infant, unless said infant be over 14 years of age as hereinafter directed in section 21-108, the court shall give preference to -
the parents, or either of them, if living; or
the spouse if the infant is married to a person 18 years of age or
when in the judgment of the court the parent or spouse is a suitable person to have the management of the infant's estate.
